Description: The requirement that personal data processing must be lawful and based on a valid legal ground such as consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, or legitimate interests.
The principle requiring controllers to be transparent about data processing activities and provide clear information to data subjects about how their personal data is being used.

The controller's responsibility to demonstrate compliance with data protection principles through documentation, policies, and measures including data protection impact assessments and records of processing.
The principle of processing only personal data that is necessary and relevant to the stated purposes, avoiding collection of excessive or unnecessary information.

Concept_Name: Data Protection by Design and Default
Description: The obligation to implement privacy-protective measures by default in data processing systems and throughout the lifecycle of personal data processing.
The obligation to notify supervisory authorities and affected data subjects of security breaches or unauthorized access to personal data without undue delay.

Processing of personal data by a natural or legal person so that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and subject to technical and organizational measures.
The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data.
